dmca.title: Red Hat puts red flag to copied training materials
dmca.body:
Dear Sir: 

The following is a Notice for Claims of Intellectual Property Violations. Red Hat, Inc. requests that you immediately take down the material listed below as Red Hat is the owner of the copyrighted material and the material has been posted without Red Hat's permission. 

1. The copyrighted materials at issue is the website: 
http://techie2go.googlepages.com/rhce.html

2. A description of the copyright violation can be found at the following links (and each page thereafter): 
http://techie2go.googlepages.com/
http://techie2go.googlepages.com/rhce.html
http://techie2go.googlepages.com/rhce_abt.html
http://techie2go.googlepages.com/tshoot.html
http://techie2go.googlepages.com/rhce_tips.html
http://techie2go.googlepages.com/inst-1.htm
http://techie2go.googlepages.com/inst-1.htm
http://techie2go.googlepages.com/inst-1.htm

3. My contact information is as follows: 
[private] 
Legal Specialist 
Red Hat, Inc. 
[private]
Raleigh, NC 27606
[private]
[private]@redhat.com

4. The owner of the site is [private] ([private]@gmail.com) 

5. have a good faith belief that the disputed use is not authorized by Red Hat, Inc., the Owner of the above referenced material, its agent, or the law. 

6. I make this statement under penalty of perjury, that the above information in this notice is accurate and that Red Hat, Inc. is the copyright owner. 

Thank you very much, 
[signed]
[private]
Legal Specialist
